definitions.definition: Something that is extracted or drawn out.
A portion of a book or document, incorporated distinctly in another work; a citation ; a quotation .
examples: I used an extract of Hemingway's book to demonstrate culture shock.

definitions.definition: A decoction , solution, or infusion made by drawing out from any substance that which gives it its essential and characteristic virtue
Any substance extracted is such a way, and characteristic of that from which it is obtained
examples: quinine is the most important extract of Peruvian bark.

definitions.definition: A solid preparation obtained by evaporating a solution of a drug, etc., or the fresh juice of a plant (distinguished from an abstract ).
A peculiar principle (fundamental essence) once erroneously supposed to form the basis of all vegetable extracts.
A draft or copy of writing; a certified copy of the proceedings in an action and the judgment therein, with an order for execution.

main_definition: Something that is extracted or drawn out.
secondary_definitions: A portion of a book or document, incorporated distinctly in another work; a citation ; a quotation .
A decoction , solution, or infusion made by drawing out from any substance that which gives it its essential and characteristic virtue
Any substance extracted is such a way, and characteristic of that from which it is obtained
A solid preparation obtained by evaporating a solution of a drug, etc., or the fresh juice of a plant (distinguished from an abstract ).
( obsolete ) A peculiar principle (fundamental essence) once erroneously supposed to form the basis of all vegetable extracts.
A draft or copy of writing; a certified copy of the proceedings in an action and the judgment therein, with an order for execution.
